meanings.definition: To moderate or soften in tone or feeling.
meanings.sent1: She attempered her voice to sound gentle when speaking to the children.
meanings.sent2: The musician attempered the melody to create a soothing atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The comedian attempered his jokes to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness attempered the harsh reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The sunset attempered the sky with warm hues, painting a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a particular condition or environment.
meanings.sent1: He attempered his schedule to accommodate the new project.
meanings.sent2: The plants attempered to the different levels of sunlight in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The car attempered its speed to match the flow of traffic.
meanings.sent4: She attempered her expectations to align with reality.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon attempered its colors to blend in with the surroundings.
